snippet.title: The Deal Trailer
snippet.description:
The Deal is a total conversion singleplayer mission mod for Call of Duty 4 which is heavily inspired from the 007 James Bond movies along with other video games and movies. 
👇👇👇Click Show More 👇👇👇

The Deal: https://www.moddb.com/mods/cod4-the-deal

Rooftops 2: https://www.moddb.com/mods/cod4-rooftops-2-red-alert

Discord: https://discord.gg/Rs68sr4

Rooftops Campaign: https://www.moddb.com/mods/cod4-rooftops-mappack

Music Used: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AkUb2VTHOx4
I do not own rights to the music. The music belongs to the rightful owners.

The mod has many graphical improvements that were achieved by porting a plethora of high quality assets from later call of duty games, even from the remastered versions.

There will be three chapters where you will play as different factions each time with a different objective even though they all connected.

The majority of the mission takes place in a luxurious hotel with a fictional representation of London as background. A busy street as well as tall city buildings dominate the exteriors of the hotel.

The Deal is using the Rooftops 2 Campaign mod as a base to develop expand upon. There will be many assets such as UI design and various script systems that are derived from Rooftops 2 to speed up the development, improve the efficiency of the existing codes, and provide a stable experience similar to the one in Rooftops 2.

Aside from the same mod base that The Deal and Rooftops 2 share, their plots are also connected. The Deal is a prequel of Rooftops 2, it takes place two years before Rooftops 1 and Rooftops 2 events. Most of the main Rooftops 2 characters will make their appearance and will play an important role in The Deal.

The Deal is an ambitious project which aims on bringing an entertaining singleplayer mission, with high quality assets and visuals, fun gunfights, innovative playable sequences, and surprising twists. It is a long awaited project that will finally rise up to its full potential.

Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare is a 2007 first-person shooter video game developed by Infinity Ward and published by Activision. It is the fourth main installment in the Call of Duty series. The game breaks away from the World War II setting of previous entries and is instead set in modern times. Developed for over two years, Modern Warfare was released in November 2007 for the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and Microsoft Windows, and was ported to the Wii as Call of Duty: Modern Warfare – Reflex Edition in 2009.

The story takes place in the year of 2011, where a radical leader has executed the president of an unnamed country in the Middle East, and an ultranationalist movement ignites a civil war in Russia. The conflicts are seen from the perspectives of a U.S. Marine Force Recon sergeant and a British SAS commando and are set in various locales, such as the United Kingdom, the Middle East, Azerbaijan, Russia, and Ukraine. The multiplayer portion of the game features various game modes and contains a leveling system that allows the player to unlock additional weapons, weapon attachments, and camouflage schemes as they advance.

Call of Duty is a first-person shooter video game franchise published by Activision. Starting out in 2003, it first focused on games set in World War II. Over time, the series has seen games set in the midst of the Cold War, futuristic worlds, and the modern day. The games were first developed by Infinity Ward, then also by Treyarch and Sledgehammer Games. Several spin-off and handheld games were made by other developers. The most recent title, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II, was released on October 28, 2022.

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II is a 2022 first-person shooter game developed by Infinity Ward and published by Activision. It is a sequel to the 2019 reboot, and serves as the nineteenth installment in the overall Call of Duty series.[2] It was released on October 28, 2022, for the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S.[3]

Like its predecessor, the game takes place in a realistic and modern setting. The campaign follows multinational unit Task Force 141 and Mexican Special Forces unit Los Vaqueros as they attempt to track down Iranian Quds Force major and terrorist Hassan Zyani, who is in possession of American-made ballistic missiles. The game's main playable characters are John "Soap" MacTavish and Kyle "Gaz" Garrick of Task Force 141. Running on a new version of the IW engine, multiplayer mode supports cross-platform multiplayer and features a free-to-play battle royale mode, Warzone 2.0, a follow-up to the original Warzone.
